intro: Lastrea noveboracensis, commonly known as the New York lastrea, is a rare and unique plant native to the northeastern United States. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae, characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are upright and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Lastrea noveboracensis is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
